name: svelte-proximity-prefetch
description: Prefetch pages when user's mouse approaches links.
readme:
# svelte-proximity-prefetch A Svelte wrapper that automatically prefetches pages based on the user's cursor position. Right now it is approximation-based. A voronoi-based approach is planned. ## Installation ```bash # npm npm install svelte-proximity-prefetch # yarn yarn add svelte-proximity-prefetch # pnpm pnpm add svelte-proximity-prefetch # bun bun add svelte-proximity-prefetch ``` ## Usage ### Basic Example Wrap your app layout with the `ProximityPrefetch` component: ```svelte
About Contact
``` ### Customization You can customize the prefetching behavior with these props: ```svelte ``` #### Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | -------------------- | ------ | ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | `threshold` | number | 200 | Distance in pixels that triggers prefetching when mouse approaches a link | | `predictionInterval` | number | 100 | Interval in milliseconds to check for nearby links | ## Credits Based on @tannerlinsley's [work](https://x.com/tannerlinsley/status/1908723776650355111) for [TanStack Router](https://tanstack.com/router/latest). Implementation based on @pontusab's [gist](https://gist.github.com/pontusab/6f10cf651533e3fe466b0c856e1dcf19) of a Next.js implementation. ## License MIT
